SEARCH
Package MODE

Class Special_Cost_Zone

java.lang.Object
MODE.Special_Cost_Zone
public class Special_Cost_Zone extends Object
Represents a special cost zone within the grid. A special cost zone is a rectangular area defined by two corner coordinates (inferior-left and superior-right) and an associated movement cost. Movement edges that are part of the perimeter of this zone will incur this special cost.

  • Field Summary

    private int
    custo
    The cost associated with moving along an edge that is part of this special cost zone's perimeter.

    • afetaAresta

      public boolean afetaAresta(Coordenadas from, Coordenadas to)
      Checks if a movement edge between two adjacent coordinates is affected by this special cost zone. An edge is affected if both its 'from' and 'to' coordinates lie on the perimeter of this zone.
      Parameters:
      from - The starting Coordenadas of the movement.
      to - The ending Coordenadas of the movement.
      Returns:
      true if the edge is affected by this zone's cost, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if 'from' and 'to' are not adjacent (Manhattan distance not equal to 1).

    • isOnPerimeter

      private boolean isOnPerimeter(Coordenadas c)
      Checks if a given coordinate lies on the perimeter (border) of this special cost zone. This means the coordinate's x or y value must match one of the boundary values of the zone (x1, x2, y1, y2) while also being within the other dimension's range.
      Parameters:
      c - The Coordenadas to check.
      Returns:
      true if the coordinate is on the perimeter, false otherwise.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the special cost zone, including its corner coordinates and associated cost.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A formatted string describing the special cost zone.
